items.creator: Brendan Hesse
items.title: Replace Your Logitech Harmony Express with a Free Harmony Elite Remote Right Now
items.dc:creator: Brendan Hesse
items.content:
Logitech will sunset its Harmony Express remote in just a few weeks, after barely a full year on the market. Don’t worry, though; you’ll be able to get an even better smart remote for free. But you should put in the request sooner rather than later.

Read more...

items.creator: Abu Zafar
items.title: Always Back Up Your Data Before Leaving a Job
items.dc:creator: Abu Zafar
items.content:
Before you turn in that resignation letter to your boss, it’s important to take care of some data management first. In the video above, I go over the steps you should take to back up your data and erase any personal information from work devices.

Read more...

items.creator: Beth Skwarecki on Vitals, shared by Beth Skwarecki to Lifehacker
items.title: Any COVID-19 'Cure' Is a Scam
items.dc:creator: Beth Skwarecki on Vitals, shared by Beth Skwarecki to Lifehacker
items.content:
This is your periodic reminder that there is still no known cure, nor specific pharmaceutical preventative or treatment, for COVID-19. So if anybody is selling one, it’s a scam.

Read more...
items.contentSnippet: This is your periodic reminder that there is still no known cure, nor specific pharmaceutical preventative or treatment, for COVID-19. So if anybody is selling one, it’s a scam. Read more...

items.creator: David Murphy
items.title: How to Get Started With the iOS 14 Public Beta
items.dc:creator: David Murphy
items.content:
For those of you who feared installing iOS 14 as a developer beta, worry not. It’s public beta time, which means this preview version of Apple’s latest iPhone operating system might be a little buggy, but not nearly as wild as what some of us have been using for weeks now.

Read more...

It’s public beta time, which means this preview version of Apple’s latest iPhone operating system might be a little buggy, but not nearly as wild as what some of us have been using for weeks now. Read more...

items.creator: David Murphy
items.title: Install Android 11 Beta 2 for New Gesture Navigation and More
items.dc:creator: David Murphy
items.content:
Android 11 beta 2 is here. That means we’re just one beta away from a Release Preview, otherwise known as “the beta you want to get if you want to try new features in as stable an environment as possible.” From there, it’s on to the Android 11 final release. So close!

Read more...
items.contentSnippet: Android 11 beta 2 is here. That means we’re just one beta away from a Release Preview, otherwise known as “the beta you want to get if you want to try new features in as stable an environment as possible.” From there, it’s on to the Android 11 final release. So close!Read more...

items.creator: Claire Lower on Skillet, shared by Claire Lower to Lifehacker
items.title: There's No Such Thing as 'Weird' Meat
items.dc:creator: Claire Lower on Skillet, shared by Claire Lower to Lifehacker
items.content:
About three years ago, I removed a pig’s face from its skull, packed it with herbs, zest, and spices, and sous-vided it for many hours to make a porchetta di testa. This process was recorded and made into a video (my first for Lifehacker), and it made a lot of people very angry.

Read more...
items.contentSnippet: About three years ago, I removed a pig’s face from its skull, packed it with herbs, zest, and spices, and sous-vided it for many hours to make a porchetta di testa. This process was recorded and made into a video (my first for Lifehacker), and it made a lot of people very angry.Read more...

items.creator: Imani Bashir
items.title: Everything You Need to Know About the EU Travel Ban
items.dc:creator: Imani Bashir
items.content:
As more and more international flights resume, many countries have placed bans on who can enter their borders and who cannot. The United States, for instance, is banned from the European Union, due to the spike of COVID-19 cases in the States. Here’s everything you need to know about the EU travel ban.

Read more...

The United States, for instance, is banned from the European Union, due to the spike of COVID-19 cases in the States. Here’s everything you need to know about the EU travel ban.Read more...

items.creator: Meghan Moravcik Walbert on Offspring, shared by Meghan Moravcik Walbert to Lifehacker
items.title: The Wiggles Are Hosting a Free Virtual Camp for Preschoolers
items.dc:creator: Meghan Moravcik Walbert on Offspring, shared by Meghan Moravcik Walbert to Lifehacker
items.content:
It’s still virtual summer camp season, and the latest free camp to be announced is one that many little kids will be pumped to attend: The Wiggles’ Virtual Summer Camp.

Read more...

items.creator: Kate Dore
items.title: Find Out Who Got a PPP Loan with ProPublica's New Tool
items.dc:creator: Kate Dore
items.content:
Are you curious to see if your employer or local businesses got a slice of the government’s $2.2 trillion stimulus package? This week, ProPublica, an independent, non-profit newsroom, released a new Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) tracking tool.

Read more...

items.creator: Kristin Wong on Two Cents, shared by Joel Cunningham to Lifehacker
items.title: A Beginner’s Guide to Filling Out Your W-4
items.dc:creator: Kristin Wong on Two Cents, shared by Joel Cunningham to Lifehacker
items.content:
Maybe you started your first job or maybe you gave up the freelance life for full-time employment. Whatever your scenario, if you find yourself filling out a W-4 for the first time, you may be a touch confused by all the fields, worksheets, and forms. Yes, the IRS can make things confusing. Let’s take it one step at a…

Read more...

items.creator: Claire Lower on Skillet, shared by Claire Lower to Lifehacker
items.title: Add an Egg Yolk to Your Grits and Savory Oatmeal
items.dc:creator: Claire Lower on Skillet, shared by Claire Lower to Lifehacker
items.content:
The egg yolk is the best part of the egg. There is no denying this. Yolks are basically neat little orbs of rich, golden sauce that taste good on everything, and you should add them to your savory breakfast cereals, especially grits.

Read more...

items.creator: Thorin Klosowski and Emily Long
items.title: How to Fix the Most Common iMessage Problems
items.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski and Emily Long
items.content:
iMessage is one of the perks of being inside the Apple universe: The service gets around text messaging fees so you can send messages to other Apple users for free, and it works on wifi so you can message anywhere you don’t have a cell connection—on an airplane, for example, or when traveling abroad without a data…

Read more...

items.creator: Beth Skwarecki on Vitals, shared by Beth Skwarecki to Lifehacker
items.title: Don't Keep Wipes in Your Car
items.dc:creator: Beth Skwarecki on Vitals, shared by Beth Skwarecki to Lifehacker
items.content:
As a suburban mom, my car is my home base. (Or it was in pre-pandemic times, anyway.) If there was a tiny chance I might need something someday while I was out and about, it lived in the car. Sunscreen? Check. Diapers? A whole case, in the trunk. Wipes? Probably a couple packages. There’s a problem with that last one,…

Read more...

If there was a tiny chance I might need something someday while I was out and about, it lived in the car. Sunscreen? Check. Diapers? A whole case, in the trunk. Wipes? Probably a couple packages. There’s a problem with that last one,…Read more...

items.creator: Meghan Moravcik Walbert on Offspring, shared by Meghan Moravcik Walbert to Lifehacker
items.title: How to Match Your Kid With a Bike That Fits
items.dc:creator: Meghan Moravcik Walbert on Offspring, shared by Meghan Moravcik Walbert to Lifehacker
items.content:
It used to be that when it was time to buy my son a new bike, we’d take him to the store and let him try a couple out. Usually just him sitting on one for a few moments was enough to tell us if a bike was too small, too big or just right. Well, around here in Eastern Pennsylvania (and in many other areas), bikes have…

Read more...

items.creator: Kate Dore on Two Cents, shared by Kate Dore to Lifehacker
items.title: Why It Matters That the Consumer Bureau Has Ditched Payday Lending Restrictions
items.dc:creator: Kate Dore on Two Cents, shared by Kate Dore to Lifehacker
items.content:
On Tuesday, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), a financial watchdog agency, made headlines by rolling back rules for payday lenders. The revised rules say lenders no longer have to assess if borrowers can afford to repay short-term loans.

Read more...
items.contentSnippet: On Tuesday, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), a financial watchdog agency, made headlines by rolling back rules for payday lenders. The revised rules say lenders no longer have to assess if borrowers can afford to repay short-term loans.Read more...

items.creator: David Murphy
items.title: How to Multitask in Gmail on Your iPad
items.dc:creator: David Murphy
items.content:
Before you start reading this, pull out your iPad, pull up the App Store, and make sure you’ve updated to the latest version of the Gmail app. If you’re using iPadOS 13 or later, you’ll now be able to multitask—finally—which means you’ll be able to access your many, many emails while having other apps loaded and…

Read more...

items.creator: Claire Lower on Skillet, shared by Claire Lower to Lifehacker
items.title: 12 Seasonings I Keep by My Stove at All Times
items.dc:creator: Claire Lower on Skillet, shared by Claire Lower to Lifehacker
items.content:
I believe, in everyone’s kitchen, there is a collection of seasonings and flavoring agents that one leans on quite heavily. I’m not talking about salt—which, for me, is another discussion entirely. I’m talking about the other shakers and bottles, the ones that are used so often they never make it back into a cabinet.…

Read more...
